Package camzup.core

Class Vec4

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Vec4
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Vec4>
Direct Known Subclasses:
KtVec4
public class Vec4 extends Object implements Comparable<Vec4>
A mutable, extensible class influenced by GLSL. Instance methods are limited, while most static methods require an explicit output variable to be provided.

May also be used to store alternative color representations.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Vec4.AbstrComparator
    An abstract class that may serve as an umbrella for any custom comparators of Vec4 s.
    static class 
    Vec4.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of vector easing functions.
    static class 
    Vec4.Lerp
    A linear interpolation functional class.

  • Field Details

    • w

      public float w
      Component on the w axis. Commonly used to store 1.0 for points and 0.0 for vectors when multiplying with a 4 x 4 matrix.

    • x

      public float x
      Component on the x axis.

    • y

      public float y

      public Vec4(Vec3 v3, float w)
      Promotes a Vec3 to a Vec4 with an extra component.

      Useful for multiplying a 4 x 4 matrix with either a 3D vector or a 3D point. (For points, w is 1.0; for vectors, w is 0.0 .)
      Parameters:
      v3 - the vector
      w - the w component

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Vec4 v)
      Returns -1 when this vector is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of vectors to be sorted.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Vec4>
      Parameters:

    • toArray

      public float[] toArray(float[] arr, int i)
      Puts the vector's components into an existing array at the index provided. The vector's x component is assigned to element i; its y component, to element i + 1; its z component, to element i + 2; its w component, to element i + 3.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      i - the index
      Returns:
      the array

    • bezierPoint

      public static Vec4 bezierPoint(Vec4 ap0, Vec4 cp0, Vec4 cp1, Vec4 ap1, float step, Vec4 target)
      Returns a point on a Bezier curve described by two anchor points and two control points according to a step in [0.0, 1.0] . When the step is less than zero, returns the first anchor point. When the step is greater than one, returns the second anchor point.
      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point
      step - the step
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the point along the curve

    • bezierTangent

      public static Vec4 bezierTangent(Vec4 ap0, Vec4 cp0, Vec4 cp1, Vec4 ap1, float step, Vec4 target)
      Returns a tangent on a Bezier curve described by two anchor points and two control points according to a step in [0.0, 1.0] . When the step is less than zero, returns the first anchor point subtracted from the first control point. When the step is greater than one, returns the second anchor point subtracted from the second control point.
      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point
      step - the step
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the tangent along the curve
      See Also:
      • sub(Vec4, Vec4, Vec4)

    • bezierTanUnit

      public static Vec4 bezierTanUnit(Vec4 ap0, Vec4 cp0, Vec4 cp1, Vec4 ap1, float step, Vec4 target)
      Returns a normalized tangent on a Bezier curve.
      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point
      step - the step
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the tangent along the curve
      See Also:
      • bezierTangent(Vec4, Vec4, Vec4, Vec4, float, Vec4)
      • Utils.invSqrt(float)

    • distMinkowski

      public static float distMinkowski(Vec4 a, Vec4 b, float c)
      Finds the Minkowski distance between two vectors. This is a generalization of other distance formulae. When the exponent value, c, is 1.0, the Minkowski distance equals the Manhattan distance; when it is 2.0, Minkowski equals the Euclidean distance.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      c - exponent
      Returns:
      the Minkowski distance
      See Also:
      • Math.pow(double, double)
      • Math.abs(double)

    • distSq

      public static float distSq(Vec4 a, Vec4 b)
      Finds the Euclidean distance squared between two vectors. Equivalent to subtracting one vector from the other, then finding the dot product of the difference with itself.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      Returns:
      the distance squared

      normalized - the normalized vector
      Returns:
      the rescaled vector
      See Also:
      • normalize(Vec4, Vec4)
      • mul(Vec4, float, Vec4)

    • right

      public static Vec4 right(Vec4 target)
      Returns to a vector with a positive value on the x axis, (1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0) .
      Parameters:
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the right vector

      public static Vec4 round(Vec4 v, Vec4 target)
      Rounds each component of the vector to the nearest whole number.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the rounded vector
      See Also:
      • Utils.round(float)

      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the sign
